intro: Ouratea margaretae, commonly known as the Margaretae Ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a glossy surface, and it produces small, red berries that are edible for some bird species. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
